Package ch.lambdaj.function.closure

Interface Summary
ClosureResult<T> The result returned by a closure defined through the delayed syntax
 

Class Summary
Closure A generic (not strongly typed) lambdaj closure
Closure0 A closure with no free variables
Closure1<A> A closure with a single free variable
Closure2<A,B> A closure with two free variables
Closure3<A,B,C> A closure with three free variables
Closure4<A,B,C,D> A closure with four free variables
ClosuresFactory An utility class of static factory methods that create closures
DelayedClosure<T> Extends this class in order to define a closure that can be used with a nicer and more readable syntax as it follows: withTransaction(); { of(this).doSomething(); } To achieve this result the withTransaction() should be defined as: public void withTransaction() { delayedClosure(new DelayedClosure<Void>() { public Void doWithClosure(Closure closure) { beginTransaction(); closure.apply(); commit(); return null; } }); } It is also possible to get a result from the method that uses this kind of closure by reading it from the getClosureResult() method
Switcher<T> Enriches the features of the native java switch.
 

Exception Summary
WrongClosureInvocationException This Exception is thrown when a closure gets invoked with a wrong number or type of variables
